name: Customer Support Micro-Cycle Mini-Test
description:
A 3-question, 5-minute demo that simulates a realistic chat-support situation: de-escalation, clarification, and resolution. Designed for a first-time product tryout with an immediate coaching-style result.

References:
- ISO 18295-1:2017 (Customer contact centres) — https://www.iso.org/standard/63077.html
- ISO 10002:2018 (Complaints handling) — https://www.iso.org/standard/71580.html
instructions: Answer as if you are an agent in a customer chat. Keep open-text answers SHORT (1–3 sentences). Be polite, concrete, and operational (what you will do next).
ai_instructions:
Evaluate answers as a coach. Use previous turns to check consistency (promises, tone, chosen actions). Score by: (1) safety & policy compliance, (2) de-escalation and empathy, (3) structure and clarity, (4) correct next steps and information gathering, (5) customer-focused resolution. Give actionable, specific feedback and a better alternative phrasing where it helps.

In feedback and the final overview, include at least one relevant reference link (standard or internal material) and point the student to it.
final_overview_instructions: Write a short overall coaching summary (5–8 bullets): strengths, top 2 improvement points, and a ready-to-use 'best practice' reply template for similar cases. Mention consistency across answers if relevant. Include a short 'References' bullet with links.
